column3: I have nothing to say to outsiders.
Yes? Come to inquire about najool, have you?
What kind of place is this?
I am but a humble grove worker. Though najool─Ja Tiika bananas, as you call them─may have an unusual appearance, they are actually quite sweet.
I have proposed various uses for the glowing peels, such as employing them to cure animal skins, or adding them to medicines. Unfortunately, my ideas are not very popular...
This is Golmajiik Grove, where we cultivate najool. As you can see, it is one of the brighter, more open locations in Mamook.
The fruit is primarily consumed by our own people, but the leaves...w-well, outsiders are known to use them as well. I'm afraid I can say no more on the matter. Trade secrets, and all.
To think we could grow other crops here... Nevertheless, I intend to remain a najool farmer, as I always have. They are a precious part of our culture, after all.
Blessed siblings no longer stand in the highest position of power. I know this, and yet the truth has not fully sunk in. But perhaps this forest will succeed in changing after all...
